metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Vue Introduction
Vue is a JavaScript framework . It can be added to an HTML page with a <script> tag.
content.html: Vue is a JavaScript framework. It can be added to an HTML page with a <script> tag.

content.text: Vue extends HTML attributes with Directives , and binds data to HTML with Expressions .
content.html: Vue extends HTML attributes with Directives, and binds data to HTML with Expressions.

content.text: Vue is a JavaScript Framework
Vue is a front-end JavaScript framework written in JavaScript.
content.html: Vue is a front-end JavaScript framework written in JavaScript.

content.text: Similar frameworks to Vue are React and Angular, but Vue is more lightweight and easier to start with.
content.html: Similar frameworks to Vue are React and Angular, but Vue is more lightweight and easier to start with.

content.text: Vue is distributed as a JavaScript file, and can be added to a web page with a script tag:
content.html: Vue is distributed as a JavaScript file, and can be added to a web page with a script tag:

content.code_html:
<script
  src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js">
</script>

content.text: Why Learn Vue?
If some of these points are hard to understand, don't worry, you will understand at the end of the tutorial.
content.html: If some of these points are hard to understand, don't worry, you will understand at the end of the tutorial.

content.text: The Options API
There are two different ways to write code in Vue: The Options API and The Composition API.
content.html: There are two different ways to write code in Vue: The Options API and The Composition API.

content.text: The underlying concepts are the same for both the Options API and Composition API, so after learning one, you can easily switch to the other.
content.html: The underlying concepts are the same for both the Options API and Composition API, so after learning one, you can easily switch to the other.

content.text: The Options API is what is written in this tutorial because it is considered to be more beginner-friendly, with a more recognizable structure.
content.html: The Options API is what is written in this tutorial because it is considered to be more beginner-friendly, with a more recognizable structure.

content.text: Take a look at this page at the end of this tutorial to learn more about the differences between the Options API and the Composition API.
content.html: Take a look at this page at the end of this tutorial to learn more about the differences between the Options API and the Composition API.

content.text: My first page
We will now learn how we can create our very first Vue web page, in 5 basic steps:
content.html: We will now learn how we can create our very first Vue web page, in 5 basic steps:

content.text: These steps are described in detail below, with the full code in a 'Try It Yourself' example in the end.
content.html: These steps are described in detail below, with the full code in a 'Try It Yourself' example in the end.

content.text: Step 1: HTML page
Start with a simple HTML page:
content.html: Start with a simple HTML page:

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <title>My first Vue page</title>
</head>
<body>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Step 2: Add a <div>
Vue needs an HTML element on your page to connect to.
content.html: Vue needs an HTML element on your page to connect to.

content.text: Put a <div> tag inside the <body> tag and give it an id:
content.html: Put a <div> tag inside the <body> tag and give it an id:

content.code_html:
<body>
  <div id="app"></div>
</body>

content.text: Step 3: Add a link to Vue
To help our browser to interpret our Vue code, add this <script> tag:
content.html: To help our browser to interpret our Vue code, add this <script> tag:

content.code_html: <script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>

content.text: Step 4: Add the Vue instance
Now we need to add our Vue code.
content.html: Now we need to add our Vue code.

content.text: This is called the Vue instance and can contain data and methods and other things, but now it just contains a message.
content.html: This is called the Vue instance and can contain data and methods and other things, but now it just contains a message.

content.text: On the last line in this <script> tag our Vue instance is connected to the <div id="app"> tag:
content.html: On the last line in this <script> tag our Vue instance is connected to the <div id="app"> tag:

content.code_html:
<div id="app"></div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>

<script>

  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        message: "Hello World!"
      }
    }
  })

 app.mount('#app')

</script>

content.text: Step 5: Display 'message' with Text Interpolation
Finally, we can use text interpolation , a Vue syntax with double curly braces {{ }} as a placeholder for data.
content.html: Finally, we can use text interpolation, a Vue syntax with double curly braces {{ }} as a placeholder for data.

content.code_html: <div id="app"> {{ message }} </div>

content.text: The browser will exchange {{ message }} with the text stored in the 'message' property inside the Vue instance.
content.html: The browser will exchange {{ message }} with the text stored in the 'message' property inside the Vue instance.

content.text: Here is our very first Vue page:
content.html: Here is our very first Vue page:

content.code: {{ message }}
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <title>My first Vue page</title>
</head>
<body>

  <div id="app">
    {{ message }}
  </div>

  <script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>

  <script>
    const app = Vue.createApp({
      data() {
        return {
          message: "Hello World!"
        }
      }
    })

   app.mount('#app')

  </script>
</body>
</html>

content.text: Text Interpolation
Text interpolation is when text is taken from the Vue instance to show on the web page.
content.html: Text interpolation is when text is taken from the Vue instance to show on the web page.

content.text: The browser receives the page with this code inside:
content.html: The browser receives the page with this code inside:

content.code_html: <div id="app"> {{ message }} </div>

content.text: Then the browser finds the text inside the 'message' property of the Vue instance and translates the Vue code into this:
content.html: Then the browser finds the text inside the 'message' property of the Vue instance and translates the Vue code into this:

content.code_html: <div id="app">Hello World!</div>

content.text: JavaScript in Text Interpolation
Simple JavaScript expressions can also be written inside the double curly braces {{ }} .
content.html: Simple JavaScript expressions can also be written inside the double curly braces {{ }}.

content.code:
{{ message }}
{{'Random number: ' + Math.ceil(Math.random()*6) }}
content.code_html:
<div id="app">
  {{ message }} <br>
  {{'Random number: ' + Math.ceil(Math.random()*6) }}
</div>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>

<script>

  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        message: "Hello World!"
      }
    }
  })

 app.mount('#app')

</script>

content.text: Get Started
This tutorial will teach you the basics of Vue.
content.html: This tutorial will teach you the basics of Vue.

content.text: You need basic prior experience with HTML , CSS and JavaScript to follow this tutorial.
content.html: You need basic prior experience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript to follow this tutorial.

content.text: Click the 'Next' button to continue with this tutorial.
content.html: Click the 'Next' button to continue with this tutorial.

content.text: Vue Exercises
Test Yourself With Exercises
Exercise:
Use text interpolation to display the 'message' data property value.
content.html: Use text interpolation to display the 'message' data property value.

content.code_html:
<div id="app"></div>
<script src="https://unpkg.com/vue@3/dist/vue.global.js"></script>
<script>
  const app = Vue.createApp({
    data() {
      return {
        message: "Hello World!"
      }
    }
  })
  app.mount('#app')
</script>

content.text: Start the Exercise
content.html: Start the Exercise
